definition[0]: to decide how something should be shared among various people
example[0]: It’s not easy to apportion blame  (=say who deserves to be blamed) when a marriage breaks up.
example[1]: Court costs were equally apportioned between them.
definition[1]: to divide and share something between a number of people or organizations
example[2]: a scheme which will apportion shares in state enterprises to the general public
example[3]: Funding will be apportioned between the country’s local education authorities.
